column4: I'm finding LAN and wireless don't like each other on my laptop (using Dapper)
Has anyone else had this problem?
If I leave the office without deactivating ethernet, my wireless won't work at home
My card info is as follows: RealTek RTL8139  Identified 8139 chip type 'RTL-8100B/8139D'
yeah, it sure is. But then, ACPI really doesn't like this either. :)
I tried a test this morning: closed all apps, locked the screen and then came back about 15 minutes later. Machine was locked up. Had to reboot.
I'm not complaining - I think Dapper rules!
I used to be a huge SuSE fan, but this is much better for daily computing
which part? The acpi or the networking?
I don't know, you said your comp froze
hahaha, sorry, too much coffee on my part. :)
You can say that again, hyper :P
yeah, me, too, normally, but thought I'd give it a second chance (hated it under Red Hat)
